programme.desc: A terrorist escapes custody during a prisoner handover when the convoy he is being transported in is attacked, leading to a CIA operative being killed and relations becoming frayed between British and American intelligence agencies. MI5 officer Will Holloway must team up with disgraced intelligence chief Harry Pearce to track him down before an imminent terrorist attack on London. Spy thriller, starring Kit Harington and Peter Firth.

programme.title: The Captive
programme.desc: A couple are plagued by the disappearance of their young daughter, eight years after she went missing, and a series of disturbing incidents seem to indicate that she is still alive. Thriller, starring Ryan Reynolds, Kevin Durand, Mireille Enos and Rosario Dawson.

programme.title: Zulu
programme.desc: Two South African police officers, one black and one white, investigate the murder of a teenage girl. The case brings to light the lingering consequences of apartheid, and forces both men to face up to their own roles in their country's brutal history. Crime drama based on Caryl Ferey's novel, with Forest Whitaker and Orlando Bloom.

programme.title: American History X
programme.desc: A neo-Nazi is thrown into prison for murder and gradually comes to realise the error of his ways. On his release, he discovers his younger brother is heading down the same extremist path, and tries to stop the teenager from repeating his mistakes. Drama, starring Edward Norton, Edward Furlong, Avery Brooks, Fairuza Balk and Stacy Keach.

programme.title: Deep Family Secrets
programme.desc: A girl sets out on a personal quest to discover the truth about her mother's alleged abduction, and uncovers a tangled tale of adultery, incest and murder. Thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Angie Dickinson and Meg Foster.

programme.title: Grand Piano
programme.desc: A pianist prepares to make his comeback performance after a concert ruined by stage fright years previously. As he prepares to take the stage, he receives a chilling anonymous message, telling him that he will be killed by a sniper if he makes a single mistake. Thriller, starring Elijah Wood and John Cusack.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.

programme.title: Kidnapping Freddy Heineken
programme.desc: Five men struggling to make ends meet decide to kidnap a beer tycoon who is one of Europe's richest men. The plan is a success, and they demand the biggest ransom in history - but tensions within the group threaten their chances of escaping the law. Fact-based crime drama, starring Anthony Hopkins, Jim Sturgess and Sam Worthington.

programme.title: Ocean's Eleven
programme.desc: A suave ex-convict assembles a gang of sophisticated crooks to pull off a daring heist. He intends to rob three of Las Vegas's biggest casinos simultaneously - and also win back his estranged wife, who is now dating the ruthless owner of all three gambling establishments. Steven Soderbergh's crime comedy, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Matt Damon and Bernie Mac.

programme.title: Ocean's Twelve
programme.desc: The crooks reunite when an old enemy catches up with them and demands they repay the money they stole from him three years previously. In response, the gang comes up with another larcenous plan - but reckons without the interventions of a fellow thief and a sultry Interpol agent. Crime caper sequel, starring George Clooney, Brad Pitt, Julia Roberts, Catherine Zeta-Jones, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Don Cheadle.

programme.title: Ocean's Thirteen
programme.desc: Danny Ocean rounds up his band of crooks for one last heist. Gang member Reuben has been left traumatised and in a coma after being double-crossed by crooked casino owner Willy Bank, and Danny decides that payback is in order. He plans a scheme that will leave Bank penniless, but needs the help of an old enemy. Comedy crime caper sequel, with George Clooney, Al Pacino, Brad Pitt, Matt Damon, Andy Garcia and Elliott Gould.

programme.title: Along Came a Spider
programme.desc: A police forensic psychologist searches for the daughter of a senator, who has been kidnapped from her expensive private school by a media-obsessed teacher, sparking a desperate race to hunt down her psychotic and devilishly intelligent captor before it is too late. Thriller prequel to Kiss the Girls, starring Morgan Freeman, Monica Potter, Michael Wincott, Dylan Baker and Penelope Ann Miller.

programme.title: Son of a Gun
programme.desc: An Australian teen jailed for a minor offence is taken under the protective wing of a veteran criminal. On his release, the youngster is invited to join the older man's gang, which is in the process of planning a major gold heist, but finds his loyalties put to the test. Crime drama, starring Brenton Thwaites, Ewan McGregor and Alicia Vikander.

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A maverick detective vows to catch a racist criminal suspected of murdering an innocent black man. However, the only witness is reluctant to talk, and the killer comes from a very wealthy family, prompting the tough-talking cop to quit the force and bring in the culprit on his own terms. Remake of the blaxploitation thriller, starring Samuel L Jackson, Christian Bale and Toni Collette.

programme.title: Annabelle
programme.desc: A man buys his pregnant wife a vintage doll, which places their lives in jeopardy. Members of a Satanic cult have their eyes on the antique toy, and break into their house to prepare a ritual that will transform the harmless plaything into a terrifying monster. Horror spin-off from The Conjuring, starring Annabelle Wallis and Ward Horton.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.

programme.title: Superman II
programme.desc: The Man of Steel meets his match in the form of three fugitive villains from his home planet of Krypton. Flying down to Earth, the super-powered trio unleash a reign of terror in a bid to take over the world - but Superman is not there to stop them, having surrendered his powers to lead a normal life with his beloved Lois Lane. Comic-strip adventure sequel, with Christopher Reeve, Gene Hackman, Terence Stamp and Margot Kidder.

programme.title: Sphere
programme.desc: Scientists are sent on a government mission to examine a mysterious artefact found in an alien craft submerged in the Pacific Ocean - but as they try to unlock its secrets, they discover the object has mind-altering powers that could endanger all mankind. Barry Levinson's sci-fi thriller, adapted from the novel by Michael Crichton, starring Dustin Hoffman, Samuel L Jackson, Sharon Stone, Liev Schreiber and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: Three sleep-deprived people gather at a house haunted by evil spirits to take part in an insomnia study. It soon becomes clear they are really there to aid a scientist's investigation into the origins of fear - and from the very first night, the visitors find themselves facing their deepest and most secret terrors as they confront the unknown forces prowling the corridors. Horror remake, starring Liam Neeson, Lili Taylor, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Owen Wilson.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Fearless hunter Allan Quatermain teams up with a host of other characters from Victorian literature - including Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Tom Sawyer and Dr Jekyll - to put a stop to the nefarious Fantom's evil plot to bring about a world war. Fantasy adventure, based on Alan Moore's comic-book series, starring Sean Connery, Shane West, Stuart Townsend, Richard Roxburgh, Peta Wilson and Tony Curran.

programme.title: Sphere
programme.desc: Scientists are sent on a government mission to examine a mysterious artefact found in an alien craft submerged in the Pacific Ocean - but as they try to unlock its secrets, they discover the object has mind-altering powers that could endanger all mankind. Barry Levinson's sci-fi thriller, adapted from the novel by Michael Crichton, starring Dustin Hoffman, Samuel L Jackson, Sharon Stone, Liev Schreiber and Queen Latifah.

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.

programme.title: Alex Zane's Cinecast
programme.desc: Alex Zane takes a look at the new films coming to Sky Cinema this month, highlighting all the biggest premieres and some of his personal favourites.

programme.title: The Haunting
programme.desc: Three sleep-deprived people gather at a house haunted by evil spirits to take part in an insomnia study. It soon becomes clear they are really there to aid a scientist's investigation into the origins of fear - and from the very first night, the visitors find themselves facing their deepest and most secret terrors as they confront the unknown forces prowling the corridors. Horror remake, starring Liam Neeson, Lili Taylor, Catherine Zeta-Jones and Owen Wilson.

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Fearless hunter Allan Quatermain teams up with a host of other characters from Victorian literature - including Captain Nemo, the Invisible Man, Tom Sawyer and Dr Jekyll - to put a stop to the nefarious Fantom's evil plot to bring about a world war. Fantasy adventure, based on Alan Moore's comic-book series, starring Sean Connery, Shane West, Stuart Townsend, Richard Roxburgh, Peta Wilson and Tony Curran.

programme.title: Watchmen
programme.desc: At the height of the Cold War, former superheroes driven into retirement by public outcry are confronted with the murder of one of their number. As they face the possibility of a conspiracy to eliminate them, they must contend with a world edging closer to the brink of nuclear war. Sci-fi drama, based on Alan Moore and Dave Gibbons' graphic novel, starring Patrick Wilson, Jackie Earle Haley, Malin Akerman and Billy Crudup.

programme.title: The Visit
programme.desc: Two children are sent by their parents to spend a week at their grandparents' remote farm. They are confused by the old couple's strange house rules, but as they investigate, they discover something disturbing is going on - and that they may not be returning home alive. Horror, starring Olivia DeJonge and Ed Oxenbould.

programme.title: Lucy
programme.desc: A courier is kidnapped and forced to become a drug mule. When she is exposed to the experimental chemicals she is smuggling, it boosts her intelligence and reflexes to superhuman levels. She uses her newfound abilities to get revenge on her captors, but as the process continues, she evolves into something more than human. Sci-fi thriller, starring Scarlett Johansson and Morgan Freeman.

programme.title: Hollow Man
programme.desc: A brilliant scientist tests an invisibility serum on himself, but becomes dangerously intoxicated by the power he acquires. He abandons his morals and heads out into the city to take full advantage of his condition. Realising he has been up to no good, concerned colleagues decide to confront him - with terrible consequences. Paul Verhoeven's sci-fi thriller, starring Kevin Bacon, Elisabeth Shue, Josh Brolin and Kim Dickens.

programme.title: Ghostbusters: Special
programme.desc: The making of the long-awaited horror comedy sequel, including interviews with Melissa McCarthy and the rest of the cast.

programme.title: Little Shop of Horrors
programme.desc: A weedy flower-shop assistant grows a bizarre plant, which he discovers needs to feed on human blood to survive. It grows to a vast size and begins to talk, demanding he commit murder on its behalf. Comedy musical based on the Broadway show, starring Rick Moranis, Ellen Greene, Steve Martin and Bill Murray, with the voice of The Four Tops' Levi Stubbs.

programme.title: Armageddon
programme.desc: Nasa discovers an asteroid the size of Texas is on a collision course with Earth, so a drilling expert is recruited to train a team of misfits to transport a nuclear device into outer space to destroy it - but having had no experience of space travel, the reluctant astronauts find themselves seriously out of their depth. Sci-fi thriller, with Bruce Willis, Ben Affleck, Liv Tyler, Michael Clarke Duncan, Billy Bob Thornton and Steve Buscemi.

programme.title: Babylon AD
programme.desc: A mercenary in a post-apocalyptic future accepts a job escorting a mysterious girl and the nun protecting her from Russia to New York. Along the way, she exhibits strange powers that could hold the key to mankind's salvation - but various factions are plotting to put her gifts to their own use. Sci-fi adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Michelle Yeoh, Melanie Thierry, Gerard Depardieu and Charlotte Rampling.

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro.

programme.title: Babylon AD
programme.desc: A mercenary in a post-apocalyptic future accepts a job escorting a mysterious girl and the nun protecting her from Russia to New York. Along the way, she exhibits strange powers that could hold the key to mankind's salvation - but various factions are plotting to put her gifts to their own use. Sci-fi adventure, starring Vin Diesel, Michelle Yeoh, Melanie Thierry, Gerard Depardieu and Charlotte Rampling.

programme.title: The Chronicles of Riddick
programme.desc: Fugitive Riddick evades capture by bounty hunters and steals their spacecraft, only to run into an even bigger threat - fanatical cult members on a sinister mission to kill or convert anyone who crosses their path as they seek galactic domination. Sci-fi adventure sequel, with Vin Diesel reprising his role from Pitch Black alongside Judi Dench, Alexa Davalos and Thandie Newton.

programme.title: Transformers
programme.desc: Teenager Sam Witwicky is treated to his first car by his dad, but it turns out to be an alien scout with a life of its own. Before long, the vehicle embroils Sam in a long-running intergalactic war between two factions of giant shape-changing robots, which have come to Earth to find a mystical cube that grants infinite power to its possessor. Michael Bay's sci-fi action adventure, inspired by the toy franchise, with Shia LaBeouf, Megan Fox, Josh Duhamel, Jon Voight and John Turturro.

programme.title: The Gallows
programme.desc: A high-school play ends in tragedy when a boy is accidentally killed during a performance. The school puts on another production of the same show 20 years later which a gang of camcorder-wielding students intend to sabotage - but nobody is prepared for the ghost of the dead boy returning to terrorise the performance. Found-footage horror, starring Reese Mishler and Pfeifer Brown.

programme.title: Deliverance
programme.desc: Four city friends look forward to a weekend canoeing trip in America's Deep South. However, their adventure turns into a nightmare when menacing rednecks come down from the nearby hills and subject them to a shocking assault, forcing the men to take extreme action to save their lives. John Boorman's thriller based on James Dickey's novel, with Burt Reynolds, Jon Voight, Ronny Cox, Ned Beatty and Bill McKinney.

programme.title: The Wild Bunch
programme.desc: Ageing outlaws, bound by a private code of honour and friendship, find themselves at odds with early 20th-century society, and come to realise their era has passed. Hired to steal guns for a tyrannical Mexican general, they instead decide to turn against him. Sam Peckinpah's Western, starring William Holden, Ernest Borgnine, Robert Ryan, Warren Oates, Strother Martin and Edmond O'Brien.

programme.title: Strangers on a Train
programme.desc: A charming psychopath meets a tennis professional on a train and suggests that they each commit a murder on the other's behalf. However, when the deranged man goes through with his part of the deal, the sportsman faces a race against time to prove his innocence. Alfred Hitchcock's thriller, based on the novel by Patricia Highsmith, starring Robert Walker, Farley Granger and Ruth Roman.

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: A hard-boiled cavalry scout with a feral dog as companion stumbles across a woman and her child stranded on their homestead deep inside hostile territory. Despite repeated attacks by the Apaches, they refuse to leave their home, leaving the scout with no choice but to stay and defend her. Western, starring John Wayne, Geraldine Page, Ward Bond and Michael Pate.

programme.title: True Story
programme.desc: A disgraced New York Times reporter discovers that an accused killer has assumed his identity, and the resulting investigation turns into a game of cat and mouse. Fact-based drama, starring Jonah Hill, James Franco and Felicity Jones.

programme.title: Partisan
programme.desc: A young boy raised to be an assassin starts to question the ways of his community's charismatic and domineering leader. Drama, with Vincent Cassel, Jeremy Chabriel and Florence Mezzara.

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.

programme.title: The Overnight
programme.desc: A couple and their young son move to another city, and find themselves feeling adrift in a strange place. Things seem to change for the better when they meet another family and spend the evening at their new friends' house - but things quickly take a disturbing turn once the kids are in bed. Black comedy, starring Adam Scott, Taylor Schilling and Jason Schwartzman.

programme.title: Interstellar
programme.desc: In the future, Earth has been devastated by an environmental catastrophe and will soon become incapable of supporting human life. A former astronaut is recruited to carry out a desperate mission - piloting the last remaining spacecraft through a wormhole in search of another planet that can become humanity's new home. Sci-fi drama, starring Matthew McConaughey, Anne Hathaway and Michael Caine.

programme.title: The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
programme.desc: A laconic gunslinger, a ruthless hired killer and a conniving outlaw hunt for a cache of loot during the chaos of the American Civil War. However, each is privy to only part of the information necessary to find it, setting in motion a series of deadly betrayals. The third film in Sergio Leone's Spaghetti Western trilogy, starring Clint Eastwood as the Man with No Name, with Lee Van Cleef and Eli Wallach. With a soundtrack by Ennio Morricone.

programme.title: Birdman: Or (The Unexpected Virtue of Ignorance) (2014)
programme.desc: A faded movie star famous for his role in a series of superhero movies 20 years previously tries to reclaim his artisitic integrity by directing and starring in a Broadway play. The experience plunges him into a personal crisis as both the production and his own family are beset by a series of disasters. Oscar-winning drama, starring Michael Keaton, Edward Norton and Emma Stone.

programme.title: Things to Do in Denver When You're Dead
programme.desc: A hard-up reformed crook agrees to pay off his debts by doing one last job for his psychotic former boss. He reunites with a motley group of one-time criminals, but unfortunately they botch the assignment and a hitman is sent to finish them off. Thriller, starring Andy Garcia, Christopher Walken, Treat Williams, Gabrielle Anwar and Steve Buscemi.

programme.title: Hondo
programme.desc: A hard-boiled cavalry scout with a feral dog as companion stumbles across a woman and her child stranded on their homestead deep inside hostile territory. Despite repeated attacks by the Apaches, they refuse to leave their home, leaving the scout with no choice but to stay and defend her. Western, starring John Wayne, Geraldine Page, Ward Bond and Michael Pate.

programme.title: Rawhide
programme.desc: Outlaws hold staff and a passenger and her baby hostage at a remote stagecoach station while awaiting the arrival of a shipment of $100,000 in gold bullion. The nervous captives try to stay calm, but the tension between the gang leader and a jumpy henchman grows fraught, ending in a frantic shoot-out - with the infant in the thick of the fray. Western, starring Tyrone Power, Susan Hayward and Jack Elam.

programme.title: Insomnia
programme.desc: A detective is sent to Alaska to investigate a murder during a month when the sun does not set. Sleep deprivation starts to take its toll, and he accidentally shoots his partner dead. He tries to cover it up, but the criminal they were hunting has seen everything and blackmails the cop into helping him escape justice. Thriller directed by Christopher Nolan, starring Al Pacino, Robin Williams and Hilary Swank.

programme.title: Rushmore
programme.desc: A student causes chaos in an exclusive private school with his temperamental nature - and things go from bad to worse when he develops a crush on a teacher. A wealthy but miserable businessman strikes up a friendship with the troubled teenager, but when he also falls for the same woman, all-out war is declared. Wes Anderson's comedy drama, starring Jason Schwartzman, Bill Murray, Olivia Williams and Brian Cox.

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.

programme.title: Play Misty for Me
programme.desc: A DJ has a one-night stand with an obsessive woman who repeatedly calls his station with the same song request. When he revives his relationship with an old flame, his unstable fan is driven mad with jealousy. Psychological thriller, directed by and starring Clint Eastwood, with Jessica Walter, Donna Mills, John Larch and James McEachin.

programme.title: The Machinist
programme.desc: A factory worker suffering from chronic insomnia has not slept properly in more than a year. When his extreme fatigue results in a tragic accident, his colleagues turn on him and he sinks into a state of intense paranoia, becoming obsessed with a man nobody else believes exists. Psychological thriller, starring Christian Bale, Jennifer Jason Leigh and Michael Ironside.

programme.title: As Good as It Gets
programme.desc: A bigoted misanthropic writer, who treats everyone he meets with contempt, is forced to look after a gay neighbour's dog, and develops an empathy with another creature for the first time in years. Sensing a need for human company, he pursues an unlikely romance with a waitress, who is the only person willing to put up with his rudeness. Romantic comedy drama, with Jack Nicholson, Helen Hunt, Cuba Gooding Jr and Greg Kinnear.

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: A talented young jazz drummer thinks all his dreams have come true when he lands a place at a prestigious music academy. However, the experience turns into a nightmare thanks to an uncompromising tutor who will stop at nothing to make his students realise their potential - including physical and mental abuse. Drama, starring Miles Teller, JK Simmons and Paul Reiser.

programme.title: Dope
programme.desc: A geeky teenager in an inner-city neighbourhood harbours dreams of going to Harvard. He and his friends think their social standing at school is set to improve when they get an invitation to an underground party, but the night leaves them mixed up in crime and drugs and forced to grow up fast. Crime comedy, starring Shameik Moore and Tony Revolori.

programme.title: Training Day
programme.desc: A cop embarks on his first day in narcotics, partnering a seasoned officer whose willingness to flout the rules forces him to question everything he has learnt. As they resort to extreme measures to crack a case, the rookie is left battling his conscience in a dangerous situation. Thriller, starring Denzel Washington, Ethan Hawke, Scott Glenn and Tom Berenger.

programme.title: Dragon
programme.desc: A craftsman's violent past as a deadly martial artist comes to light when he fights off two gangsters menacing a shopkeeper. The incident attracts the attention of a dogged detective who tries to uncover the truth about this mysterious man, while the criminal underworld also takes an interest in him. Martial arts thriller, starring Donnie Yen and Takeshi Kaneshiro. In Mandarin.

programme.title: Lonely Are the Brave
programme.desc: A rebellious modern-day cowboy breaks out of jail and escapes on horseback - but reckons without the relentlessness of the authorities, who give chase by car and helicopter. A dogged sheriff leads the pursuit, coming to sympathise with his quarry. Western, starring Kirk Douglas, Walter Matthau, Gena Rowlands and George Kennedy.

programme.title: Reap the Wild Wind
programme.desc: The owner of a 19th-century salvage company falls in love with a captain she rescues from a shipwreck, and helps him prove in court that the vessel's sinking was not his fault. However, the lawyer hired to plead the case also falls for the salvager, and the rivalry drives the captain into an alliance with a ruthless pirate. Romantic adventure, starring John Wayne and Paulette Goddard.

programme.title: North to Alaska
programme.desc: Gold prospector Sam travels to Seattle to fetch his partner George's fiancee. When he discovers she has married someone else, Sam takes it upon himself to find a suitable replacement. Unfortunately, his attempts to bring the substitute bride and George together do not go to plan, and a conman is trying to get his hands on their gold. Comedy Western, starring John Wayne, Stewart Granger, Capucine and Ernie Kovacs.

programme.title: Clear and Present Danger
programme.desc: A CIA analyst gets caught up in the Colombian drug trade while trying to track down terrorists responsible for the murder of a close friend of the US president - but his investigations point to illegal activity and corruption at the very top of government. Action thriller, based on Tom Clancy's novel, with Harrison Ford reprising his role from Patriot Games alongside Willem Dafoe, Anne Archer and James Earl Jones.

programme.title: The Heat
programme.desc: An uptight, ambitious FBI agent is sent to Boston to bring a notorious drug kingpin to justice. She ends up forced to team up with a rebellious, foul-mouthed local police detective who has a very different attitude to law enforcement but shares her inability to work with others. Action comedy, starring Sandra Bullock and Melissa McCarthy.

programme.title: Haywire
programme.desc: A mercenary is employed by the US government to carry out secret assignments, but on her latest mission, she is set up by one of the operatives who hired her. She fights her way through the world of international espionage in search of revenge, fending off assassins as she tries to find out who betrayed her. Action thriller, starring Gina Carano, Ewan McGregor, Michael Fassbender and Antonio Banderas.

programme.title: sex, lies and videotape
programme.desc: An impotent man, who delights in recording interviews with women about their sexual experiences, has a profound effect on an old friend's troubled marriage. Drama, starring James Spader, Andie MacDowell, Peter Gallagher and Laura San Giacomo.

programme.title: Stagecoach
programme.desc: A group of strangers, including a drunken doctor, a pregnant army officer's wife and an embezzling bank clerk, embarks on a dangerous journey across hostile territory. They are joined by an outlaw, falsely accused of murder, who helps them when a Sioux war party attacks. Remake of John Ford's Western, with Bing Crosby and Ann-Margret.

programme.title: Sahara
programme.desc: An American tank crew get lost in the desert during the retreat from El Alamein and face a desperate race against time to reach a source of water in an abandoned fortress - only to discover the Nazis are heading for the same location. Second World War melodrama which is all the more effective thanks to the straightforward nature of the plot and action. Humphrey Bogart, J Carrol Naish, Dan Duryea and Rex Ingram are among the excellent cast.

programme.title: The Gunfighter
programme.desc: Gunslinger Jimmy Ringo looks forward to a life of domestic peace after being given a chance to settle down with his once estranged wife and their child. However, a young upstart with dreams of slaying a legend challenges Ringo to a gunfight but dies, setting his three vengeful brothers on the older man's trail. Western, starring Gregory Peck, Millard Mitchell, Karl Malden and Helen Westcott.

programme.title: Lifeboat
programme.desc: The survivors of a torpedoed passenger ship are set adrift in a lifeboat. As they pull out other survivors from the sea, they realise one of them is the U-boat commander responsible for the disaster. Alfred Hitchcock's Second World War drama, starring Tallulah Bankhead, Walter Slezak, William Bendix, Hume Cronyn and Henry Hull.

programme.title: Adventures in Babysitting
programme.desc: A teenager agrees to look after her neighbour's children when her date stands her up. Settling down for a night of TV, she receives a phone call from a friend asking to be rescued from a bus station. Unable to leave the children alone, she decides to take them with her, unaware of the wild journey ahead. Comedy adventure, starring Elisabeth Shue and Maia Brewton.

programme.title: Ender's Game
programme.desc: In the future, the human race has survived conflict with an alien race, but the prospect of war breaking out again is a constant threat. A gifted boy is selected as a potential military commander for the coming conflict, and subjected to a gruelling training program to prove his worth. Sci-fi adventure based on Orson Scott Card's novel, starring Asa Butterfield, Harrison Ford and Ben Kingsley.

programme.title: Knowing
programme.desc: Widowed astrophysicist John Koestler decodes a page of numbers revealing the dates of past and future global disasters. While racing to avert a succession of catastrophes, he realises the numbers point toward a final apocalypse. Mystery thriller, starring Nicolas Cage, Rose Byrne and Chandler Canterbury.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part one of two. Two English children come to stay with the Baldwin sisters after they are evacuated from London during the Blitz.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Part two of two. Two English children come to stay with the Baldwin sisters after they are evacuated from London during the Blitz.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Nellie Oleson snubs Laura and Mary for wearing homespun dresses on their first day at school, so Caroline teaches her sister how to win the bully's friendship.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Charles hears about a well-paid but dangerous job as he and the Walnut Grove men make a 100 mile-long walk in search of work after the wheat crop is ravaged by a hailstorm.

programme.title: The Cry
programme.desc: Part two of two. Meg's abduction of Eleanor hits the headlines, forcing her to go on the run under an assumed name. She breaks into Christine's family home and poses as a journalist in the hope of uncovering evidence of child abuse. Psychological thriller, starring Sarah Lancashire, Emma Cunniffe and Anthony Calf.

programme.title: Mistaken Identity
programme.desc: A mix-up in a maternity ward results in two new mothers unwittingly taking home the wrong babies - leaving them to face a terrible dilemma once the truth comes to light. Drama based on a true story, starring Melissa Gilbert, Rosanna Arquette, David Andrews and James McCaffrey.

programme.title: A Change of Heart
programme.desc: A happily married woman learns the hard way that her husband has been hiding a dark secret from her - by unexpectedly walking in on him and his lover, another man. Drama, starring Jean Smart, John Terry and Dorian Harewood.

programme.title: Gone in the Night
programme.desc: Conclusion of the two-part drama. Shannen Doherty and Kevin Dillon star as parents searching for clues to the whereabouts of their seven-year-old daughter, snatched from her bed as they slept. Drama, with Edward Asner, Dixie Carter and Michael Brandon.

programme.title: The Crooked E: The Unshredded Truth About Enron
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the scandal surrounding the collapse of the American company, which left employees jobless and thousands of people without their life savings. Based on an insider's memoirs, starring Christian Kane, Shannon Elizabeth and Mike Farrell.

programme.title: Prophet of Evil: The Ervil LeBaron Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama, about religious fanatic Ervil LeBaron, who believed he had God's permission to kill anyone standing in the way of his drive for wealth and power. Starring Brian Dennehy, Tracy Needham and William Devane.

programme.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Desperate Deception
programme.desc: A US Marine travels to France in search of an escaped Nazi. However, no sooner has he located his quarry, than the war criminal is murdered leaving the soldier the prime suspect. Enter the crusading attorney, who battles to prove his innocence - but to do so, he will have to uncover secrets buried for 45 years. Courtroom mystery, starring Raymond Burr, Ian McShane, William R Moses, Yvette Mimieux and Ian Bannen.

programme.title: Perry Mason: The Case of the Telltale Talk Show Host
programme.desc: An unpopular radio presenter is murdered and the finger points at a colleague - until Perry uncovers a host of famous suspects who had reason to do the dirty deed. Courtroom mystery, starring Raymond Burr, with TV personalities Montel Williams and Regis Philbin.

programme.title: Death in the Shadows
programme.desc: A man becomes convinced that his father is innocent of murdering his mother - despite his conviction in a court of law. Determined to get to the truth, he begins his own investigation, but faces an arduous struggle to ensure the real killer is finally brought to justice. Fact-based thriller, starring Peter Strauss, Henry Czerny and Lindsay Frost.

programme.title: My Son Johnny
programme.desc: A boy's life is thrown into turmoil when his older brother returns home and begins a terrifying campaign of torture and mental abuse. His stubborn mother's refusal to accept the truth leads to tragedy. Fact-based drama, starring Michele Lee, Rick Schroder and Corin Nemec.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Olivia turns to her aunt for advice as she finds going through the menopause difficult, and Jim Bob resorts to dishonest means to get a job.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The family celebrate having paid all their debts, but discover a friend is in desperate need of financial help. The girls try to find a suitable wife for Rev Buchanan.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: While in Mankato, Charles encounters a drunken Mr Edwards in the midst of a bar fight and brings him to Walnut Grove. To rehabilitate him, he gets him a job at Hansen's Mill, and Caroline tries to set him up with widow Grace Snider.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: Jealousy rears its head when Laura falls in love with a boy who is more interested in Mary.

programme.title: Santa and Pete
programme.desc: A widower worries about facing his first Christmas since his wife died, but finds comfort in telling his 10-year-old grandson a traditional Dutch tale about Father Christmas's amazing travels, including an occasion when the jolly old fellow needed help from a kindly cook. Children's fantasy, starring James Earl Jones, Hume Cronyn, Flex Alexander, Tempestt Bledsoe, Emily Mae Young and Sedrathe Gillespie.

programme.title: The Christmas Shoes
programme.desc: A little boy is determined to do whatever he can to buy his dying mother a pair of expensive red shoes. Along the way, his tireless efforts inspire an amazing transformation in the life of a cold-hearted lawyer struggling to cope with the slow disintegration of his marriage. Festive family drama, starring Rob Lowe, Maria Del Mar, Max Morrow and Kimberly Williams.

programme.title: Lethal Seduction
programme.desc: A reporter poses as an illegal immigrant and takes a job in the office of a ruthless, seductive lawyer, hoping to expose her corrupt business practices. However, his pursuit of a story is threatened when he becomes infatuated with her. Comedy drama, starring Melanie Griffith and Esai Morales.

programme.title: Runaway Father
programme.desc: A woman who has been living in poverty for 20 years following her husband's death learns that he is still alive, having faked his demise so he could abandon his family. She resolves to track him down and force him to accept his responsibilities. Fact-based drama, starring Donna Mills and Jack Scalia.

programme.title: Before He Wakes
programme.desc: Fact-based thriller about a greedy woman who marries and murders two wealthy husbands in succession, to acquire their fortunes, and almost succeeds in getting away scot-free. Starring Jaclyn Smith, Diana Scarwid, Hope Lange and Timothy Carhart.

programme.title: Stranger in the Family
programme.desc: A teenager is involved in a tragic car accident, leaving him with severe amnesia. During his struggle to come to terms with alienation and the consequent rebellion that ensues, his family are forced to accept the boy they once knew so well is now a stranger. Fact-based drama, starring Neil Patrick Harris, Teri Garr, Randle Mell and Sierra Samuel.

programme.title: Deep in My Heart
programme.desc: A white woman gives birth to a black baby following a sexual assault and resolves to give it away to foster care. However, after initially being placed in a loving home, the child is sent to live with a well-meaning but unsuitable family. Fact-based drama, starring Anne Bancroft, Lynn Whitfield, Alice Krige and Cara Buono.

programme.title: One Against the Wind
programme.desc: Biopic of Second World War heroine Mary Lindell, who helped freedom fighters and members of the Allied forces escape the clutches of the Nazis in occupied France. Starring Judy Davis, Sam Neill, Denholm Elliot and Kate Beckinsale.

programme.title: Behind the Mask
programme.desc: An overworked doctor suffers a heart attack and is saved by one of his disabled patients, leading the duo to form a strong bond reminiscent of that between father and son - a relationship both have been missing their entire lives. Drama, starring Donald Sutherland, Matthew Fox, Mary McDonnell and Brad Whitford.

programme.title: Deacons for Defence
programme.desc: A black man is pushed too far by the racist abuse and unprovoked violent assaults meted out by white bigots in the 1960s, and organises a defence group to fight back. Fact-based drama, starring Forest Whitaker, Adam Weiner, Jonathan Silverman and Serene Lee.

programme.title: Jasper, Texas
programme.desc: Fact-based drama chronicling the aftermath of a horrific race-related murder, as the media, law-enforcement agencies and a variety of controversial organisations descend on the small town where it took place. Louis Gossett Jr, Jon Voight, Roy T Anderson and Joe Morton star.

programme.title: No Place Like Home
programme.desc: An apartment guard and his family are left homeless when the building - which serves as both his workplace and home - burns down. The desperate dad seeks shelter with his brother, but a disagreement soon leaves the man and his loved ones on the street with nowhere to go. Drama, starring Jeff Daniels, Kathy Bates and Christine Lahti.

programme.title: In His Life: The John Lennon Story
programme.desc: Biopic of the singer who formed one half of the most successful and celebrated songwriting partnership of modern times. The film charts the musician's youth in Liverpool and his rise to fame with the Beatles, a group which redefined popular music during the 1960s, before recalling his solo career and tragic death outside his home in Manhattan. Starring Philip McQuillan, Blair Brown, Daniel McGowan and Jamie Glover.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Cousins Ham, Cora and Job come to stay on Walton's Mountain, but they prove to be out-and-out crooks.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: John-Boy receives a visit from cousin Homer, but the Baldwin sisters are unaware of his criminal record until he makes off with much of the stock for their reunion banquet recipe.

programme.title: Held Hostage
programme.desc: A bank manager and her daughter are kidnapped by three masked men, who tape explosives to them. The terrified mother is ordered to rob her own bank or the bombs will be set off. She manages to inform a colleague of her predicament, only to end up accused of being a willing accomplice. Thriller, starring Julie Benz and Brendan Perry.

programme.title: The Diary of Anne Frank
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama based on the famous journal of a German Jewish girl forced to go into hiding with her family from Nazis in an Amsterdam attic for two years. Starring Millie Perkins, Shelley Winters and Richard Beymer.

programme.title: Sleeping with the Devil
programme.desc: A woman's life is turned upside down by the discovery that her seemingly perfect boyfriend is psychotically unbalanced and, as his mania increases, he pays a killer to gun her down. Drama, starring Shannen Doherty, Tim Matheson, Bonnie Bartlett and Steve Eastin.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: Jason works with a black boy on an act for the spring festival, but is shocked by the racial prejudice he encounters. Elizabeth has a crush on a new boy in her class.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: An elderly farmer clashes with Mrs Oleson when he discovers she intends to take control of Walnut Grove after acquiring an old city bond.

programme.title: The Forget-Me-Not Murders
programme.desc: A policeman races against time to find a serial killer who leaves dried flowers next to each of his victims, and the chase becomes even more desperate when he learns that his goddaughter could be next on the murderer's list. Detective thriller, starring Richard Crenna, Tyne Daly, Cliff Gorman and Neve Campbell.

programme.title: Unabomber: The True Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following the life of Ted Kaczynski, one of America's most notorious terrorists, who carried out a campaign of bombings between 1978 and 1995, and threatened further violence unless his political manifesto was published. However, his own brother would prove instrumental in bringing him to justice. Starring Robert Hays, Dean Stockwell and Tobin Bell.

programme.title: The Fergie Story: Paradise Lost
programme.desc: Documentary profiling the life of Sarah Ferguson, examining the impact she made on the royal family as an institution.

programme.title: Queen Camilla
programme.desc: Friends and former staff reveal the story of Prince Charles' relationship with Camilla Parker-Bowles, revealing the tactics used by the couple to keep their romance secret.

programme.title: Born Innocent
programme.desc: A teenage runaway is sent to a centre for young offenders by her neglectful parents, where she experiences brutal treatment from the violent inmates and uncaring staff. However, one care worker is determined to help her realise her potential and escape her unhappy surroundings. Drama, starring Linda Blair and Joanna Miles.

programme.title: Unabomber: The True Story
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following the life of Ted Kaczynski, one of America's most notorious terrorists, who carried out a campaign of bombings between 1978 and 1995, and threatened further violence unless his political manifesto was published. However, his own brother would prove instrumental in bringing him to justice. Starring Robert Hays, Dean Stockwell and Tobin Bell.

programme.title: My Father, My Son
programme.desc: Fact-based drama about a US Navy Admiral's decision to use the Agent Orange defoliant during the Vietnam campaign - and the bitter realisation that it may have caused the cancer subsequently contracted by his soldier son. Starring Karl Malden, Keith Carradine, Dirk Blocker, Grace Zabriskie and Jenny Lewis.

programme.title: The Jazz Singer
programme.desc: A Jewish cantor's son goes against his strict father's wishes and travels to Los Angeles in search of fame and fortune. Remake of the 1927 musical drama, starring Neil Diamond in the role originally played by Al Jolson, with Laurence Olivier, Lucie Arnaz and Catlin Adams.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: After meeting an itinerant singer, a restless Mary Ellen decides to run away from home. However, when he does not take kindly to her following him, she disappears again and is left up to John-Boy to find her. Meanwhile, the rest of the family works hard picking apples to save enough money to send her on a trip to Washington to cure her wanderlust.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: A famous film star is stranded on the mountain when her car breaks down and is invited to stay with the Waltons, putting on a one-woman show to raise her train fare back to the city. While she charms most of the family, Olivia is not convinced by her tall tales. Pippa Scott and Dorothy Neuman guest star.

programme.title: Secret Sins of the Father
programme.desc: A bereaved police chief investigates his mother's death from a sudden heart attack and discovers she may actually have been bumped off by his father. Murder mystery, directed by and starring Beau Bridges. With Lloyd Bridges, Lee Purcell and Frederick Coffin.

programme.title: Runaway Father
programme.desc: A woman who has been living in poverty for 20 years following her husband's death learns that he is still alive, having faked his demise so he could abandon his family. She resolves to track him down and force him to accept his responsibilities. Fact-based drama, starring Donna Mills and Jack Scalia.

programme.title: This Matter of Marriage
programme.desc: Two female architects run a successful business together, and have remained single. While trying to win a contract from a billionaire, the duo decide to get back into the dating game, and go through their clients, neighbours and the internet in search of Mr Right. Romantic drama, starring Sherry Miller, Leslie Hope, Michael Nouri and Natasha Greenblatt.

programme.title: The Waltons
programme.desc: The children prepare a surprise party for John and Olivia's 25th wedding anniversary, while their parents have surprises of their own in store.

programme.title: Little House on the Prairie
programme.desc: A loner loses his mind, and threatens the lives of Laura and her daughter. Robert Loggia guest stars.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Palomino
programme.desc: A photographer, struggling to overcome the break-up of her marriage by going to live on a friend's California ranch, where her riding skills impress the ranch hands - one of whom she embarks on a passionate affair with. However, her life takes a turn for the worse when her new lover is unable to cope with the class difference between them and an accident leaves her paralysed. Drama, starring Lee Horsley, Lindsay Frost, Eva Marie Saint and Rod Taylor.

programme.title: Danielle Steel's Secrets
programme.desc: The cast of a glossy American TV series' steamy on-screen relationships pale in comparison with their behind-the-scenes antics. Drama, starring Stephanie Beacham, Christopher Plummer, Linda Purl, Gary Collins and Ben Browder.

programme.title: Princess Diana: In Search of Happiness
programme.desc: A review of the life of Diana, Princess of Wales, including her childhood, her move into the public eye, her work for charity, her marriage and her death.

programme.title: Princess Diana: A Day in the Life
programme.desc: Documentary examining Lady Diana Spencer's sometimes awkward transition into royalty and the princess's day to day life in the public eye.

programme.title: No One Could Protect Her
programme.desc: A woman is raped in her own home, but the police seem powerless to apprehend the attacker. As reports of further sexual assaults in her neighbourhood mount up, all seemingly the work of the same man, she resolves to turn detective and bring him to justice herself. Thriller based on a true story, starring Joanna Kerns, Anthony John Denison and Peter MacNeill.

programme.title: Saw
programme.desc: A killer chains two men in a basement and forces them to make grisly choices to win their freedom. Having no idea how they got there, they attempt to piece together what has happened to them and who the sadistic madman behind their imprisonment is

programme.title: Saw II
programme.desc: Darren Lynn Bousman takes the helm for this sequel, with The Jigsaw Killer inviting capture by cop Eric Mathews. But once in custody, he reveals his latest puzzle; eight people, including Mathews' son Daniel are trapped in a derelict house. If they can solve the clues, overcome the murderous traps and work together, they may be able to escape. If not, the deadly nerve gas that's in the air will kill them in just two hours

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: Prince Einon promises to end the violence of his father's reign, but becomes even more of a tyrant. So dragonslayer Bowen calls a truce with the only dragon he hasn't killed, and the pair set out to stop the new king

programme.title: Up in the Air
programme.desc: Ryan Bingham works for a company that specialises in firing people, and he's forced to take a newcomer named Natalie along on a business trip in order to show her firsthand what he does. Along the way, Ryan begins to reflect on his lonely life and develops a relationship with fellow frequent flyer Alex Goran

programme.title: Hidalgo
programme.desc: An Arab sheikh makes American rider Frank an unmissable offer: win a 3,000 mile desert race on his mustang and take home $100,000

programme.title: Death Warrant
programme.desc: Detective Jean-Claude Van Damme goes undercover in a top-security prison, charged with exposing a sinister plot. Action from the writer of Jumper

programme.title: As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM
programme.desc: Profiling DJ AM (aka Adam Goldstein), a hugely successful and influential disc jockey known for his mash-ups of popular songs. The film traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash

programme.title: The Talented Mr. Ripley
programme.desc: After a case of mistaken identity, awkward underachiever Tom Ripley is sent to escort home handsome playboy Dickie Greenleaf. But when Ripley meets the freewheeling cad he develops an unhealthy obsession, and things take a deadly turn. Drama

programme.title: Lara Croft: Tomb Raider
programme.desc: The gun-toting treasure seeker is thrown into a furious battle with a mysterious secret society as she races against time to locate the missing pieces of the Triangle of Light, a legendary artefact that grants the owner the ability to control time

programme.title: Zodiac
programme.desc: Set in the Bay Area in the 1960s and '70s, ZODIAC sees a murderer with seemingly random targets sending terrifying threats and cryptic codes to police and publishers all around San Francisco, leading fear and paranoia descend on the city

programme.title: Southpaw
programme.desc: A troubled boxer attempts to get his life together and regain his championship title after his wife is killed and his daughter is taken away by child protection services. In order to get back in fighting shape, he works with a hardened trainer at a run-down gym

programme.title: As I AM: The Life and Times of DJ AM
programme.desc: This documentary profiles DJ AM (aka Adam Goldstein), a hugely successful and influential disc jockey known for his mash-ups of popular songs. The film traces the course of his life as he found fame and fought to remain sober, only to relapse and die of a drug overdose at the age of 36 following the trauma of surviving a plane crash. Jon Favreau, Paul Oakenfold, Mark Ronson, and Steve Aoki are among the many people interviewed. Directed by Kevin Kerslake

programme.title: Reservoir Dogs
programme.desc: The grim, violent tale of a heist gone wrong. Six criminals - all with pseudonyms, and strangers to one another - are hired for a diamond robbery, but they are ambushed by police and forced to shoot their way out. At their warehouse rendezvous, the survivors, realising they were set up, try to find the traitor in their midst as this controversial exploration of betrayal moves inexorably to its blood-soaked climax

programme.title: Deterrence
programme.desc: The year is 2008 and US President Walter Emerson , is forced to make a monumental decision that will affect world history, in this taut political thriller. Trapped by a freak snowstorm in a tiny mid-American town in Colorado whilst campaigning for re-election, Emerson receives word that Iraqi dictator Uday Hussein has staged a surprise attack on Kuwait. It is the same type of attack which provoked the Gulf War in 1990, but this time Iraq has chemical and biological weapons ready to fire on Israel, Greece and Turkey

programme.title: Revolutionary Road
programme.desc: Drama based on Richard Yates's acclaimed novel, reuniting the Titanic stars Leonardo DiCaprio and Kate Winslet. April and Frank Wheeler are a young, thriving couple living with their two children in a Connecticut suburb in the mid-1950s. Their self-assured exterior masks a creeping frustration at their inability to feel fulfilled in their relationships or careers. Frank is mired in a well-paying but boring office job, and April is a housewife still mourning the demise of her hoped-for acting career. Determined to identify themselves as superior to the mediocre sprawl of suburbanites who surround them, they decide to move to France where they will be better able to develop their true artistic sensibilities, free of the consumerist demands of capitalist America. But as their relationship deteriorates into an endless cycle of squabbling, jealousy and recriminations, their trip and their dreams of self-fulfilment are thrown into jeopardy.Dir: Sam Mendes. (T) (Digital Dolby 5.1)

programme.title: Growing Up and Other Lies
programme.desc: In this fun and insightful comedy, a disillusioned artist named Jake (Josh Lawson) plans on leaving NYC to return to his hometown in Ohio. When his last day in the city arrives, he and his friends hope to relive the good times of their early years in New York by walking the entire length of Manhattan. However, the trip doesn't go as planned when he spots his ex-girlfriend (Amber Tamblyn) and buried feelings begin to emerge. At the same time, his pals (Adam Brody, Wyatt Cenac, and Danny Jacobs) examine their own issues about growing up while plotting to keep Jake from moving

programme.title: Becoming Bulletproof
programme.desc: A group of disabled Americans take part in the production of a costume-drama Western movie

programme.title: Daft Punk Unchained
programme.desc: An exploration of the mysterious music duo Daft Punk, the French musicians who are famed for performing in robot attire that hides their faces. Includes radio interviews, rare footage and exclusive interviews with their close friends and collaborators

programme.title: SXSW Comedy with Natasha Leggero
programme.desc: Natasha Leggero hosts an all-star lineup of stand-up comics, including Baron Vaughn, Andrew Santino, Emily Heller, James Adomian and Moshe Kasher. Also: a sneak peek at the SXSW festival in Austin, Texas

programme.title: Shaft
programme.desc: A slick, trigger-happy detective flouts the law as he goes on the hunt for a rich murderer whose power and influence could get him off the hook

programme.title: Killing Season
programme.desc: After the duo strike up an unlikely friendship that goes sour, a former Serbian soldier hunts an American military veteran in the remote Appalachian mountains in this masterfully tense tale of survival

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: An ex-Marine sniper is recruited for a special operation and finds himself involved in a presidential assassination attempt

programme.title: Ray Donovan
programme.desc: Federal Boobie Inspector. Ray visits a Hollywood power player in an attempt to get the Russian mob off his back and unearths a secret Ezra shared in the past. Meanwhile, Lena and an ex-girlfriend take Abby out on the town to help her confront fears over a recent health diagnosis; and Mickey offers his boys a job prospect and tries to assimilate back into the family

programme.title: No Escape
programme.desc: An American businessman relocates his family to Southeast Asia, but their lives are put in grave danger when they get caught up in a violent political uprising in this nail-biting thriller. As they attempt to reach the U.S. embassy, they are aided by a mysterious British tourist

programme.title: Roadies
programme.sub-title: The City Whose Name Must Not Be Spoken
programme.desc: The City Whose Name Must Not Be Spoken. The crew become victims of a mythical rock and roll curse and try to break it by completing some odd tasks. Meanwhile, Bill and Shelli search for Rick, the band's hard-living bassist, who has gone missing

programme.title: Death Squad
programme.desc: A rebel fights an oppressive government in the year 2047, and is aided by a vengeful mutant

programme.title: Girl House
programme.desc: A psycho stalks a group of Internet models living in a house where everything is recorded by a Webcam

programme.title: Exorcismus
programme.desc: When insular teenager Emily's behaviour turns bizarre and terrible things happen to those close to her, her parents turn to an exorcist

programme.title: Molly Moon and the Incredible Book of Hypnotism
programme.desc: A London orphan named Molly Moon studies hypnosis, and uses her powers to escape from her orphanage and search for a friend who was adopted. However, she is soon distracted by the thought of becoming a movie star via mesmerism, as well as by a thief who wants her help with a heist

programme.title: The Last Keepers
programme.desc: A teenage outcast discovers she has extraordinary powers in this charming family fantasy

programme.title: The Giver
programme.desc: In a world devoid of all conflict, a teen causes chaos after getting a glimpse of his community's troubled past. Sci-fi drama with Brenton Thwaites. Violence/flashing images. (2014)(94mins)

programme.title: The Wicked Within
programme.desc: A supernatural being torments a family one year after the death of their daughter

programme.title: The Lovers
programme.desc: A marine archaeologist slips into a coma, and goes on an epic journey across four centuries while exploring his undying love for a woman

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: Prince Einon promises to end the violence of his father's reign, but becomes even more of a tyrant. So dragonslayer Bowen calls a truce with the only dragon he hasn't killed, and the pair set out to stop the new king

programme.title: Jamie Marks Is Dead
programme.desc: The ghost of a young loner haunts a high school track star who never knew him in life. Later, the popular athlete flees his troubled home, and has a terrifying encounter with a malevolent spirit whose motivations appear to be much darker

programme.title: The Day
programme.desc: In this claustrophobic, pulse-pounding thriller, a ragtag band of postapocalyptic survivors take shelter in an abandoned farmhouse, but they soon come under siege from forces looking to wipe them out

programme.title: The Wicked Within
programme.desc: A supernatural being torments a family one year after the death of their daughter

programme.title: Patrick
programme.desc: A telekinetic coma patient torments a young nurse while he is subjected to cruel experiments

programme.title: Bloodworx
programme.desc: Two college roommates participate in a pharmaceutical test that yields terrifying results

programme.title: Jamie Marks Is Dead
programme.desc: The ghost of a young loner haunts a high school track star who never knew him in life. Later, the popular athlete flees his troubled home, and has a terrifying encounter with a malevolent spirit whose motivations appear to be much darker

programme.title: Scar Tissue
programme.desc: A young man and a female cop hunt a serial killer who supposedly died years earlier

programme.title: Dragonheart
programme.desc: Fantasy adventure about a knight who is determined to rid the land of a tyrant king. Because it was dragon magic that brought the monarch to the throne, the knight is resolved to kill every dragon in the country. Finally, only one dragon remains - but instead of slaying him, the knight and the dragon join forces in an effort to restore a code of truth and honour to the land

programme.title: Space Warriors
programme.desc: A group of bright youths attending space camp use their knowledge of science and astrophysics to help rescue three astronauts who are stranded on the International Space Station following an unexpected crisis

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped from production. The superhero reboot would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton

programme.title: Intruders
programme.desc: A young boy in Madrid and a girl in London are haunted by the same faceless apparition. Can their desperate parents banish him from their lives?

programme.title: The Gift
programme.desc: Annie Wilson's second sight attracts the attention of redneck wife-beater Donnie. But is he really responsible for the murder of promiscuous Jessica? A Southern gothic thriller with a brooding sense of menace

programme.title: Awaken
programme.desc: In this heart-pounding thriller, a Russian Special Forces soldier must escape from a mysterious island where people are harvested for their organs and continue on her quest to rescue her sister

programme.title: The Death of Superman Lives: What Happened?
programme.desc: A look at why the planned 1998 film "Superman Lives" was scrapped from production. The superhero reboot would have starred Nicolas Cage as the Man of Steel and been directed by Tim Burton

programme.title: Nightlight
programme.desc: Teens playing a spooky flashlight game in the woods at night get more than they bargained for when a demon is awakened by their shenanigans

programme.title: Gordo
programme.desc: A young father leaves his successful taco stand in Mexico to start his own restaurant in the U.S

programme.title: Adios, para siempre
programme.desc: A photographer (Gustavo Sanchez Parra) specializing in crime-scene photos runs into a serious problem. Mayra Serbulo. Written and directed by David Guillermo Barba

programme.title: Don't Blink
programme.desc: Ten friends are stranded at an abandoned mountain resort, and begin to disappear one by one in this nerve-racking thriller. Later, the few who remain race to find an answer before they vanish into thin air

programme.title: Survival Island
programme.desc: A shipwrecked couple share an ocean sanctuary with their former servant

programme.title: See No Evil
programme.desc: Brutal bloodbath with WWE superstar Kane. A group of delinquents are sent to clean a dilapidated hotel unaware that a reclusive psychopath has made it his home. Can they survive his wrath?

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: The FilmFour funded Trainspotting is acknowledged to be one of the most original films to come out of Britain in the last decade. The multi-award-winning film based on Irvine Welsh's novel, stars Ewan McGregor, Ewen Bremner, Jonny Lee Miller, Robert Carlyle, Kelly Macdonald and Kevin McKidd in a story of drugs, survival, scams, friendship and tragedy

programme.title: Brad Williams: Daddy Issues
programme.desc: Comedian Brad Williams delivers a stand-up set that tackles race and political correctness, as well as how his father raised him to deal with adversity

programme.title: Shooter
programme.desc: Mark Wahlberg gives a charged performance in this high-powered actioner about an ex-Marine sniper who is recruited for a clandestine special op and instead finds himself on the run after being targeted as the perpetrator of a presidential assassination attempt. Danny Glover, Kate Mara, Michael Pena, Tate Donovan, Ned Beatty, Rhona Mitra, Elias Koteas. Directed by Antoine Fuqua and written by Jonathan Lemkin, who adapted Stephen Hunter's book "Point of Impact."

programme.title: Pete Correale: Let Me Tell Ya
programme.desc: Comedian Pete Correale delivers a stand-up routine

programme.title: Need for Speed
programme.desc: A mechanic who moonlights as an underground race-car driver strives to take the top prize in America's most prominent street race in order to have his revenge against the ambitious ex-NASCAR champ who had him framed and sent to prison. Inspired by the popular video-game franchise of the same name, Need for Speed tells the story of garage owner Tobey Marshall (Aaron Paul). Desperate to keep his family-owned business afloat, Marshall forms an uncomfortable partnership with wealthy ex-NASCAR star Dino Brewster (Dominic Cooper). That partnership falls apart when a lucrative sale to car broker Julia Bonet (Imogen Poots) fails to pan out, and unscrupulous Brewster uses a tragic street-racing mishap to have the innocent Marshall incarcerated. Released from prison two years later, the vengeful Marshall plots to prove his mettle by winning the De Leon -- an illicit race showcasing the country's top underground talents. But getting to the De Leon will be no simple task, because not only has the ruthless Brewster put a bounty on Marshall's prized car, but the police are hot on his trail during the white-knuckle, coast-to-coast dash. Fortunately for Marshall, his loyal crew and Bonet are willing to help him get to the starting line in time for the big race. Scott "Kid Cudi" Mescudi, Ramon Rodriguez, and Michael Keaton co-star

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: A paroled thief gets sucked into an audacious heist scheme to steal a Monet painting by replacing it with a perfect duplicate

programme.title: Echoes of War
programme.desc: In this thrilling post-Civil War drama, a veteran returns home to his Texas countryside ranch. Attempting to rid himself of the horrors of war, he instead finds himself involved in a conflict with a neighboring rancher

programme.title: Maz Jobrani: I'm Not a Terrorist But I've Played One on TV
programme.desc: Comedian Maz Jobrani takes on sociopolitical issues and childrearing through the lens of his Iranian-American background

programme.title: Perfect Sisters
programme.desc: This true-crime thriller follows two teenage sisters as their drug-addled mother plans to move in with an abusive lover. In response, the pair decide to remedy their situation by plotting their mum's murder

programme.title: G.B.F.
programme.desc: The first teen to come out of the closet at North Gateway High struggles to balance his newfound popularity with his longtime friendships as the three most popular girls in school all attempt to claim him as their G.B.F. (gay best friend). The moment Tanner (Michael J. Willett) reveals his true sexuality to his classmates he rockets up the social ladder. Suddenly, he's decked out in the latest fashions, and living it up with the in-crowd. Meanwhile, the friends who used to be part of Tanner's inner circle get left out in the cold. Now Tanner will be faced with the most difficult decision of his high school career -- keep riding the popularity train and accept his role as a human fashion accessory, or go back to the people who have always accepted him for who he really is. Megan Mullally, Jonathan Silverman, Rebecca Gayheart, and Natasha Lyonne co-star in a comedy from director Darren Stein

programme.title: What If
programme.desc: Med school dropout Daniel Radcliffe meets his ideal girl, only to discover she already has a boyfriend. Can the perfect pair keep things platonic?

programme.title: The Forger
programme.desc: A paroled thief gets sucked into an audacious heist scheme to steal a Monet painting by replacing it with a perfect duplicate

programme.title: The Way of the Gun
programme.desc: Two criminal drifters without sympathy get more than they bargained for after kidnapping and holding for ransom the surrogate mother of a powerful and shady man

programme.desc: A look at the making of Nas' 1994 debut album "Illmatic," and how the sociopolitical conditions of the time influenced its creation and led to its status as a milestone in hip-hop history

programme.desc: Famed graphic designer Charles Swan III finds his life spiralling out of control after he is dumped by his gorgeous girlfriend and becomes lost in his delusions. Meanwhile, Charles's loyal friends try to help him get over his heartbreak

programme.desc: Profiling sexploitation auteur Joe Sarno, who, along with his loyal wife and creative partner Peggy, carved out a successful career in a genre that grew increasingly hard-core over the course of their lives

programme.title: Cleanskin
programme.desc: A Secret Service agent races against the clock to stop a suicide bombing by an unknown terrorist in this tense crime thriller from the UK. Undercover agent Ewan (Sean Bean) is on the trail of a London terrorist cell committed to waging jihad against Western society. His target is an anonymous Muslim radical (Abhin Galeya) whose lack of any prior conviction makes him particularly difficult to track down. As the National Security team searches frantically for clues to the bomber's identity, Ewan realizes that failure to stop the suicide bombing could deal a devastating blow to the fight for freedom

programme.title: Meet the Hitlers
programme.desc: The lives of people linked by the name Hitler are examined. Their reactions span the spectrum of human experience, from tragedy to comedy, and heartbreak to hope

programme.title: Dean Smith
programme.desc: A look at the life and legacy of University of North Carolina basketball coach Dean Smith. Includes interviews with former players and colleagues

programme.title: Arachnophobia
programme.desc: South American poisonous spiders are accidentally shipped to a small Californian town, causing deadly mayhem among the local populace. Thriller

programme.title: Return to Nim's Island
programme.desc: Adventurous teen Nim battles resort developers and poachers to protect her island and the animals that live there. As the fight to save her home intensifies, she turns to a runaway hiding out on the island for help with her quest

programme.title: Dr. T and the Women
programme.desc: The story of a wealthy Dallas gynaecologist whose life begins to fall apart at the seams when his wife suffers a nervous breakdown during a shopping spree, but then he falls for an attractive golf pro. He sends her to a mental hospital with the hopes of a full recovery, but her regression into childhood seems to be permanent. Adding to the mass confusion is an unexpected visit from his alcoholic sister-in-law, Peggy, who brings along her three children, as well as the constant battles between Dr. T's two daughters: the soon-to-be-married Dee Dee and the jealous Connie. Upon meeting his country club's new assistant golf pro, Bree, Dr. T finally feels like he's met his match - a beautiful, independent woman who has no desire to be swept off her feet

programme.title: St. Vincent
programme.desc: Ted Melfi's comedy St. Vincent stars Bill Murray as a crusty old man who ends up caring for the son of his new neighbor (Melissa McCarthy). Although he's a cynic who gambles, drinks, and frequents strip clubs, Vincent turns out to be exactly the mentor the 12-year-old kid needs as the young one adjusts to his parents' divorce, and life at a new school

programme.title: Ray
programme.desc: The story of the life and career of the legendary rhythm and blues musician Ray Charles, from his humble beginnings in the South, where he went blind at age seven, to his meteoric rise to stardom during the 1950s and 1960s

programme.title: Punch-Drunk Love
programme.desc: Paul Thomas Anderson follows 1999's MAGNOLIA with the intensely compelling character study PUNCH-DRUNK LOVE. Barry Egan is a quiet, shy, socially awkward man with an office in an out-of-the-way warehouse. He is dedicated to his job as a wholesale toilet plunger salesman, he keeps a nice apartment, and he is obsessed with special offers on grocery store products..

programme.title: The D Train
programme.desc: A man becomes obsessed with trying to convince the most-popular guy from his high school to attend their 20-year reunion

programme.title: The Life Aquatic With Steve Zissou
programme.desc: Here's a quirky and hilarious comedy-adventure that will float your boat. Bill Murray stars as a world-famous oceanographer who embarks on an expedition "to find the shark that ate my friend and destroy it...possibly with dynamite." He's joined by his wacky crew, his estranged wife (Anjelica Huston), a shady financier (Jeff Goldblum) and a pilot (Owen Wilson) who may be his son. Directed by Wes Anderson, who co-wrote the script

programme.title: St. Vincent
programme.desc: Ted Melfi's comedy St. Vincent stars Bill Murray as a crusty old man who ends up caring for the son of his new neighbor (Melissa McCarthy). Although he's a cynic who gambles, drinks, and frequents strip clubs, Vincent turns out to be exactly the mentor the 12-year-old kid needs as the young one adjusts to his parents' divorce, and life at a new school

programme.title: The Manchurian Candidate
programme.desc: Denzel Washington and Meryl Streep star in Jonathan Demme's absorbing remake of the 1962 political thriller. Washington plays a Gulf War vet troubled by nightmares about his time in Kuwait. Liev Schreiber is excellent as a soldier who served under him before returning to the States, where he has embarked on a promising political career. Directors Roger Corman and Sidney Lumet have cameos. Tina Sinatra, whose father Frank starred in the original, co-produced

programme.title: Trainspotting
programme.desc: A controversial, blackly comic view of the life of heroin addict Mark Renton (Ewan McGregor) and the group of junkies, deadbeats, thieves, liars, and psychopaths who he calls friends. Renton is a clever, witty anit-hero, who consciously chooses the life of a junkie over the utter boredom of everything else. While getting the squalor and degradation of the junkie lifestyle down to the last grotesque detail, Trainspotting also captures the way drugs give structure and meaning to otherwise aimless lives, and describes, in detail, the breathtaking rapture of a fix. Director Danny Boyle shows himself to be a unique talent, in this stunning and at times revolting follow-up to his earlier success Shallow Grave. Much of the success of the film is due to the performance of Ewan McGregor, who is both charming and repellant in the role of Mark. McGregor deftly plays the unrepentant Mark as he tells his story, and shows the same comic flair that he did in Shallow Grave. Danny Boyle challenges his audience as Mark explains his chosen lifestyle, but does not apologize for it, and it is this nonjudgmental stance that gives the film its power. The audience is asked neither to approve of Mark nor to emulate him. Boyle simply tells Mark's story, brutal, funny and loathsome as it can be, leaving the moralizing to be done by others

programme.title: Anarchy Parlor
programme.desc: A mysterious travelling tattoo artist (Robert LaSardo) and his apprentice (Sara Fabel) pass down dark arts from generations gone by in this paranoid thriller
